snp4.3:1.2: while other speak set on truth.
snp4.3:1.3: When disputes come up a sage does not get involved,
snp4.3:1.4: which is why they’ve no barrenness at all.
snp4.3:2.1: How can you transcend your own view
snp4.3:2.2: when you’re led by preference, dogmatic in belief?
snp4.3:2.4: you’d speak according to your own notions.
snp4.3:3.2: of their own precepts and observances.
snp4.3:3.3: They have an ignoble nature, say the experts,
snp4.3:3.4: since of their own accord they speak of themselves.
snp4.3:4.2: never boasts “thus am I” of their precepts.
snp4.3:4.3: They have a noble nature, say the experts,
snp4.3:4.4: not prideful for anything in the world.
snp4.3:5.1: One who has invented and created teachings,
snp4.3:5.2: and promoted them despite their defects,
snp4.3:5.4: becomes dependent on that, relying on an unstable peace.
snp4.3:6.1: It’s not easy to get over dogmatic views.
snp4.3:6.2: After evaluation, one among teachings is adopted.
snp4.3:6.3: That’s why, among these dogmas, a person
snp4.3:6.4: rejects one teaching and takes up another.
snp4.3:7.1: The cleansed one has no invented view
snp4.3:7.2: at all in the world about all the different realms.
